high-symmetry direction of pristine and BiI 3-saturated Bi 2Se 3 (0001), respectively. The latter corresponds to a complete BiI 3 triple layer plus a second one which covers about a half of the surface area as found in the SXRD analysis. For pristine Bi 2Se 3(0001), the nearly linearly dispersive Dirac topological surface state (TSS) is clearly observed. Owing to the selenium vacancy induced n-doping, the Dirac point (D
P ) lies approximately 400 meV below the Fermi energy (E
F ).
